info.title: Asset Management
info.description: Asset Management Service HTTP API. Track asset location, utilization and calibration.

parameters.name: ReturnCount
parameters.description: Whether to return the total number of assets which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value.

parameters.name: ResponseFormat
parameters.description: Gets or sets the return type. Valid options are "JSON" and "CSV".

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description: Gets or sets the destination of the request. "INLINE" (default) returns the list of resources as the body of the response. "DOWNLOAD" returns the list of resources as the body of the response and indicates to the client that it should be downloaded as a file. "FILE_SERVICE" sends the list of resources to the file ingestion service and returns the ID of the file to the client in a JSON object.

parameters.name: FileIngestionWorkspace
parameters.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace to put the file into, if the destination is "FILE_SERVICE".

post.summary: Delete one or more calibration history entries for an asset

200.description: Partial success: one or more entries could not be deleted

204.description: No content: all entries were successfully deleted

parameters.name: ReturnCount
parameters.description: Whether to return the total number of calibration history entries, disregarding the take value.

201.description: Created: a report has been created in file service

post.summary:
Simulate receiving an asset from calibration lab, the purpose of doing a dry run is to offer the UI a list of
validation errors and warnings that the UI can't know otherwise.

requestBody.description: Model containing information for asset update and location movement for assets returning from calibration.

post.summary: Move assets from calibration to locations.

Simulate sending an asset to calibration lab, the purpose of doing a dry run is to offer the UI a list of
validation errors and warnings that the UI can't know otherwise.

requestBody.description: Model containing information for asset update and location movement for assets sent to calibration.

post.summary: Send an asset to calibration lab

requestBody.description: Model containing information for asset update and location movement for assets sent to calibration.

post.summary:
Simulate moving an assets location, the purpose of doing a dry run is to offer the UI a list of
validation errors and warnings that the UI can't know otherwise.
Moving an asset to a new location
Query the ids of assets that are in progress of moving.

get.summary: Get information about the service API
Get information about the service V1 API

modelName.description: Gets or sets model name of the asset.

modelNumber.description: Gets or sets model number of the asset.

serialNumber.description: Gets or sets serial number of the asset.

vendorName.description: Gets or sets vendor name of the asset.

vendorNumber.description: Gets or sets vendor number of the asset.

busType.description: Gets or sets all supported bus types for an asset.

name.description: Gets or sets name of the asset.

assetType.description: Gets or sets all supported asset types.

firmwareVersion.description: Gets or sets firmware version of the asset.

hardwareVersion.description: Gets or sets hardware version of the asset.

visaResourceName.description: Gets or sets VISA resource name of the asset.

temperatureSensors.description:
Gets or sets an array of temperature sensor information.
The maximum number of temperature sensors allowed per asset is 1000.

supportsSelfCalibration.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports self-calibration.

supportsExternalCalibration.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports external calibration.

customCalibrationInterval.description: Gets or sets the interval represented in months used for computing calibration due date. If not set, the recommended calibration interval from the calibration model is used.

isNIAsset.description: Gets or sets whether this asset is an NI asset (true) or a third-party asset (false).

workspace.description: The ID of the workspace containing the asset.

properties.description:
Gets or sets properties of the asset.
The maximum number of properties allowed per asset is 1000.

keywords.description:
Gets or sets keywords of the asset.
The maximum number of keywords allowed per asset is 1000.

discoveryType.description: Gets or sets the discovery type.

fileIds.description:
Gets or sets the IDs of the files linked to the asset.
The maximum number of file IDs allowed per asset is 1000.

supportsSelfTest.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports self-test.

supportsReset.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports reset.

partNumber.description: Gets or sets part number of the asset.

scanCode.description: Gets or sets the scan code of the asset.

AssetCreateModel.description:
Model for an object describing the properties for creating an asset.
            
Unique Asset Identification is required to create an asset. See AssetIdentificationModel for details.

modelName.description: Gets or sets model name of the asset.

modelNumber.description: Gets or sets model number of the asset.

serialNumber.description: Gets or sets serial number of the asset.

vendorName.description: Gets or sets vendor name of the asset.

vendorNumber.description: Gets or sets vendor number of the asset.

busType.description: Gets or sets all supported bus types for an asset.

AssetIdentificationModel.description:
Model for object containing properties which identify an asset. An asset is uniquely identified by a combination of:
    - busType
    - modelName or modelNumber
    - vendorName or vendorNumber
    - serialNumber or minionId (part of the Location)

minionId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the minion where the asset is located.

physicalLocation.description:
Gets or sets the physical location of the asset. An asset can be either in a system, in which case it has a
MinionID, or be in a physical location.

parent.description: Gets or sets the parent of the asset.

resourceUri.description: Gets or sets identifier of a resource.

slotNumber.description: Gets or sets the number of the slot in which the asset is located.

AssetLocationModel.description: Model for information about the asset location, presence and the connection status of the system in which it resides.

active.description: Gets or sets number of assets which are active, i.e. present in a connected system.

outForCalibration.description: Gets or sets total number of assets out of calibration.

AssetSummaryResponse.description: Model for asset summary response containing the total number of assets, the number of assets which are active, i.e. present in a connected system, and the number of assets which are not active.

Gets or sets an array of temperature sensor information.
The maximum number of temperature sensors allowed per asset is 1000.

supportsSelfCalibration.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports self-calibration.

supportsExternalCalibration.description:
Gets or sets whether the asset supports external calibration.
Note that when an asset is updated to no longer support external calibration, its calibration data and calibration history are deleted.

customCalibrationInterval.description: Gets or sets the interval represented in months used for computing calibration due date. If not set, the recommended calibration interval from the calibration model is used.

workspace.description: The ID of the workspace containing the asset.

properties.description:
Gets or sets properties of the asset.
The maximum number of properties allowed per asset is 1000.

Gets or sets keywords of the asset.
The maximum number of keywords allowed per asset is 1000.

Gets or sets the FileIds of the asset.
The maximum number of file IDs allowed per asset is 1000.

supportsSelfTest.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports self-test.

supportsReset.description: Gets or sets whether the asset supports reset.

partNumber.description: Gets or sets part number of the asset.

outForCalibration.description: Get or set whether the asset is out for calibration.

scanCode.description: Gets or sets the scan code of the asset.

AssetUpdateModel.description:
Model for an object describing the properties for updating an asset.
            
Unique Asset Identification is required to create an asset. If the id property is not specified, a set of properties are required to identify an asset. See AssetIdentificationModel for details. If the id is specified on the model, the following properties will be ignored: busType, modelName, modelNumber, vendorName, vendorNumber and serialNumber.

utilizationIdentifier.description: Gets or sets string representing the unique identifier of an asset utilization history record.

assetIdentifier.description: Gets or sets string representing the unique identifier of an asset.

minionId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the minion where the asset is located.

category.description: Gets or sets string representing the utilization task category.

taskName.description: Gets or sets string representing the name of the task.

userName.description: Gets or sets string representing the name of the operator who utilized the asset.

startTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the start of an utilization.
This parameter has the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

endTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the end of an utilization.
This parameter has the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

heartbeatTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the heartbeat of an utilization.
This parameter has the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

assetUtilizations.description: Gets or sets array of asset utilizations.

continuationToken.description: Gets or sets a token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching asset utilization history set. When querying for asset utilization history, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of asset utilization history records, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request.

assets.description: Gets or sets array of assets.

totalCount.description: The number of matching assets, if returnCount is true. This value is set to -1 if returnCount is false.

AssetsResponse.description: Model for assets Response containing the assets satisfying the query and the total count of matching assets.

temperatureSensors.description: Gets or sets an array of temperature sensor information.

isLimited.description: Gets or sets whether the last external calibration of the asset was a limited calibration.

date.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the last date the asset was externally calibrated.

recommendedInterval.description: Gets or sets the manufacturer's recommended calibration interval in months.

nextRecommendedDate.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the recommended date for the next external calibration.

nextCustomDueDate.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the date for the next external calibration.

resolvedDueDate.description:
Gets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the resolved due date for external calibration. This
takes into account NextCustomDueDate, Asset.CustomCalibrationInterval and NextRecommendedDate.

comments.description: Gets or sets calibration comments provided by an operator.

entryType.description: Gets or sets whether SystemLink automatically discovered the calibration data for an asset or if it was manually entered.

id.description: Gets or sets the calibration entry identifier.

calibrationType.description: Gets or sets the type of calibration the asset received, such as self or external calibration.

timestamp.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the creation date of the entry.

updatedBy.description: Gets or sets the user id who created the calibration entry.

CalibrationHistoryModel.description: Model for the calibration history for an asset.

calibrationHistory.description: Gets or sets array of calibration history entries.

totalCount.description: The number of calibration history entries, if returnCount is true. This value is set to -1 if returnCount is false.

CalibrationHistoryResponse.description: Model for calibration history response containing all calibration history entries for the requested asset.

id.description: Gets or sets unique identifier of the connection history entry.

minionId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the minion where the asset is located.

physicalLocation.description: Gets or sets identifier of the physical location where the asset is located.

parent.description: Gets or sets the parent of the asset.

resourceUri.description: Gets or sets identifier of a resource.

slotNumber.description: Gets or sets the number of the slot in which the asset is located.

startTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value when the start event happened.
This parameter has the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

startSystemConnection.description: Gets or sets the system connection of the first event.

startAssetPresence.description: Gets or sets the asset presence of the first event.

endTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value when the end event happened.
This parameter has the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

endAssetPresence.description: Gets or sets the asset presence of the end event.

continuationToken.description: Gets or sets a token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching asset location history set. When querying for asset location history, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of asset location history records, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request.

assets.description: Gets or sets array of created assets.

failed.description: Gets or sets array of assets create requests that failed.

CreateAssetsPartialSuccessResponse.description: Model for create Assets Partial Success Response.

assets.description:
Gets or sets multiple assets that should be created.
The maximum number of assets allowed per request is 1000.

CreateAssetsRequest.description: Model for request body containing an array of assets that should be created.

ids.description:
Gets or sets multiple asset IDs for which to delete all data.
The maximum number of asset IDs allowed per request is 1000.

DeleteAssetsRequest.description: Model for request body containing IDs of the assets to delete all information for.

ids.description: Gets or sets array of asset identifiers which were deleted.

failed.description: Gets or sets array of asset identifiers that failed to delete.

DeleteAssetsResponse.description: Model for delete Assets Response containing the ids of the assets which were deleted, the ids of the assets which failed to be deleted and any errors encountered.

calibrationIds.description:
Gets or sets IDs of the calibration entries to delete.
The maximum number of calibration IDs allowed per request is 1000.
Gets or sets array of calibration entry identifiers that were deleted.

failed.description: Gets or sets array of calibration entry identifiers that failed to delete.

DeleteCalibrationsPartialSuccessResponse.description: Model for delete Calibrations Partial Success Response.

utilizationIdentifiers.description: Gets or sets array representing the unique identifier of an asset utilization history record.

utilizationTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the end of an asset utilization.
This parameter must have the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

filter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for assets. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid asset properties that can be used in the filter:
- AssetIdentifier: String representing the unique identifier of an asset.
- SerialNumber: String representing the serial number of an asset.
- ModelName: String representing the model name of an asset.
- ModelNumber: Unsigned integer representing the model number of an asset.
- VendorName: String representing the vendor name of an asset.
- VendorNumber: Unsigned integer representing the vendor number of an asset.
- PartNumber: String representing the part number of an asset.
- AssetName: String representing the asset name.
- AssetType: String enumeration representing the asset type. Possible values are: GENERIC, DEVICE_UNDER_TEST, FIXTURE, SYSTEM.
- FirmwareVersion: String representing the firmware version of an asset.
- HardwareVersion: String representing the hardware version of an asset.
- BusType: String enumeration representing the bus type of an asset. Possible values are: BUILT_IN_SYSTEM, PCI_PXI, USB, GPIB, VXI, SERIAL, TCP_IP, CRIO, SCXI, CDAQ, SWITCH_BLOCK, SCC, FIRE_WIRE, ACCESSORY, CAN, SWITCH_BLOCK_DEVICE, SLSC.
- IsNIAsset: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset is an NI asset or a third-party asset.
- Keywords: Collection of string values representing asset metadata keywords. Example: 'Keywords=["keyword1", "keyword2"]'.
- Properties: Collection of key-value pairs, each key-value pair representing an asset metadata property. Example: 'Properties=["key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"]'.
- Location.MinionId: String representing the identifier of the minion in which the asset is located in.
- Location.SlotNumber: Unsigned integer representing the slot number the asset is located in.
- Location.AssetState.SystemConnection: String enumeration representing the connection state of the system the asset is currently located in. Possible values are: DISCONNECTED, CONNECTED. To maintain compatibility with previous versions of SystemLink, the values [APPROVED, UNSUPPORTED, ACTIVATED] are considered equivalent to DISCONNECTED and [CONNECTED_UPDATE_PENDING, CONNECTED_UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL, CONNECTED_UPDATE_FAILED] are equivalent to CONNECTED.
- Location.AssetState.AssetPresence: String enumeration representing the present status of an asset in a system. Possible values are: INITIALIZING, UNKNOWN, NOT_PRESENT, PRESENT.
- SupportsSelfCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports self-calibration.
- SelfCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was self-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- SupportsExternalCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports external calibration.
- CalibrationStatus: String enumeration representing the calibration status of an asset. Possible values are: OK, APPROACHING_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE, PAST_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE, OUT_FOR_CALIBRATION.
- ExternalCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was externally-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- ExternalCalibration.NextRecommendedDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the recommended date for the next external calibration. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z".
This value is overwritten by the NextCustomDueDate if it is set, otherwise it is calculated based on the RecommendedInterval.
- ExternalCalibration.RecommendedInterval: Integer representing the manufacturer-recommended calibration interval, in months.
- ExternalCalibration.Comments: String representing any external calibration comments.
- ExternalCalibration.IsLimited: Boolean flag specifying whether the last external calibration was a limited calibration.

responseFormat.description: Gets or sets the return type. Valid option is "CSV".

destination.description: Gets or sets the destination of the request. "DOWNLOAD" returns the list of resources as the body of the response and indicates to the client that it should be downloaded as a file. "FILE_SERVICE" sends the list of resources to the file ingestion service and returns the ID of the file to the client in a JSON object.

fileId.description: Gets or sets file identifier in the file ingestion service.

temperatureSensors.description:

The maximum number of temperature sensors allowed per external calibration is 1000.

isLimited.description: Gets or sets whether the last external calibration of the asset was a limited calibration.

date.description:
Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the last date the asset was externally calibrated.
A date newer the the current calibration date will set the out for calibration flag to false.

recommendedInterval.description: Gets or sets the manufacturer's recommended calibration interval in months.

entryType.description: Gets or sets whether SystemLink automatically discovered the calibration data for an asset or if it was manually entered.

resourceType.description: Type of resource associated with the error

resourceId.description: Identifier of the resource associated with the error

args.description: Positional argument values for the error code

innerErrors.description: Inner errors when the top-level error represents more than one error

example.name: Skyline.OneOrMoreErrorsOccurred
example.message: One or more errors occurred. See the contained list for details of each error.

succeeded.description: The file ids which were successfully linked.

failed.description: The file ids which failed to link.

LinkFilesPartialSuccessResponse.description: Model for link files Partial Success Response.

fileIds.description:
Gets or sets file IDs associated with an asset.
The maximum number of file IDs allowed per request is 1000.

LinkFilesRequest.description: Model for the asset link files request.

assetId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the asset being moved.

systemId.description:
Gets or sets identifier of the system to which the asset is being moved.
Either this, or PhysicalLocation are mandatory

physicalLocation.description:
Gets or sets physical location to which the asset is being moved.
Either this, or SystemId are mandatory

parent.description: Gets or sets the parent within the target location to which the asset is being moved.

validLocationMovements.description: Gets or sets array of move operations that can be performed successfully.

MoveAssetsLocationPartialSuccessResponse.description: Model which represents a success response for moving assets.

assetLocationMoveOperations.description:
Gets or sets a list of operations that will move an asset from one location to another.
The maximum number of move operations allowed per request is 1000.

utilizationFilter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for asset utilization. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
Valid asset utilization properties that can be used in the filter:
- MinionId: String representing the identifier of a minion in which an asset might be located in.
- Category: String representing the utilization task category.
- UserName: String representing the name of the operator who utilized the asset.
- TaskName: String representing the name of the task.
- StartTimestamp:
    description: >-
      A date time value which can be used to specify the start of an utilization.
            
      This parameter is required to have the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.
    type: string
    format: date-time
    example: '2019-05-20T00:00:00Z'
- EndTimestamp:
    description: >-
      A date time value which can be used to specify the end of an utilization.
            
      This parameter is required to have the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.
    type: string
    format: date-time
    example: '2019-05-20T00:00:00Z'

assetFilter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for assets. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid asset properties that can be used in the filter:
- AssetIdentifier: String representing the unique identifier of an asset.
- SerialNumber: String representing the serial number of an asset.
- ModelName: String representing the model name of an asset.
- ModelNumber: Unsigned integer representing the model number of an asset.
- VendorName: String representing the vendor name of an asset.
- VendorNumber: Unsigned integer representing the vendor number of an asset.
- PartNumber: String representing the part number of an asset.
- AssetName: String representing the asset name.
- FirmwareVersion: String representing the firmware version of an asset.
- HardwareVersion: String representing the hardware version of an asset.
- BusType: String enumeration representing the bus type of an asset. Possible values are: BUILT_IN_SYSTEM, PCI_PXI, USB, GPIB, VXI, SERIAL, TCP_IP, CRIO, SCXI, CDAQ, SWITCH_BLOCK, SCC, FIRE_WIRE, ACCESSORY, CAN, SWITCH_BLOCK_DEVICE, SLSC.
- IsNIAsset: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset is an NI asset or a third-party asset.
- Keywords: Collection of string values representing asset metadata keywords. Example: 'Keywords=["keyword1", "keyword2"]'.
- Properties: Collection of key-value pairs, each key-value pair representing an asset metadata property. Example: 'Properties=["key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"]'.
- Location.MinionId: String representing the identifier of the minion in which the asset is located in.
- Location.SlotNumber: Unsigned integer representing the slot number the asset is located in.
- Location.AssetState.SystemConnection: String enumeration representing the connection state of the system the asset is currently located in. Possible values are: DISCONNECTED, CONNECTED. To maintain compatibility with previous versions of SystemLink, the values [APPROVED, UNSUPPORTED, ACTIVATED] are considered equivalent to DISCONNECTED and [CONNECTED_UPDATE_PENDING, CONNECTED_UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL, CONNECTED_UPDATE_FAILED] are equivalent to CONNECTED.
- Location.AssetState.AssetPresence: String enumeration representing the present status of an asset in a system. Possible values are: INITIALIZING, UNKNOWN, NOT_PRESENT, PRESENT.
- SupportsSelfCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports self-calibration.
- SelfCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was self-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- SupportsExternalCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports external calibration.
- CalibrationStatus: String enumeration representing the calibration status of an asset. Possible values are: OK, APPROACHING_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE, PAST_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE.
- ExternalCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was externally-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- ExternalCalibration.NextRecommendedDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the recommended date for the next external calibration. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- ExternalCalibration.RecommendedInterval: Integer representing the manufacturer-recommended calibration interval, in months.
- ExternalCalibration.Comments: String representing any external calibration comments.
- ExternalCalibration.IsLimited: Boolean flag specifying whether the last external calibration was a limited calibration.

continuationToken.description: Gets or sets a token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching asset utilization history set. When querying for asset utilization history, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of asset utilization history records, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request.

take.description: Gets or sets the maximum number of asset utilization history records to return.

orderBy.description: Gets or sets an enumeration of all fields in an Asset Utilization History record. If not provided, default ordering is applied.

orderByDescending.description: Gets or sets whether to return the asset utilization history records in descending order.

startTime.description: Start of the date range. Defaults to 90 days ago.

endTime.description: End of the date range. Defaults to current time.

QueryAssetUtilizationHistoryRequest.description: Model for object containing filters for asset utilization and assets. When continuation token is used, the orderBy parameter needs to be provided as well.

ids.description: Gets or sets identifiers of the assets to be retrieved.

responseFormat.description: Gets or sets the return type. Valid options are "JSON" and "CSV".

destination.description: Gets or sets the destination of the request. "INLINE" (default) returns the list of resources as the body of the response. "DOWNLOAD" returns the list of resources as the body of the response and indicates to the client that it should be downloaded as a file. "FILE_SERVICE" sends the list of resources to the file ingestion service and returns the ID of the file to the client in a JSON object.

fileIngestionWorkspace.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace to put the file into, if the destination is "FILE_SERVICE".

skip.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to skip in the result when paging. For example, a list of 100 resources with a skip value of 50 will return entries 51 through 100.

take.description: Gets or sets how many resources to return in the result, or -1 to use a default defined by the service. The maximum value for Take is 1000. For example, a list of 100 resources with a take value of 25 will return entries 1 through 25.

orderBy.description: Field by which assets can be ordered/sorted. If OrderBy is not specified, no sorting will applied. OrderBy is supported only for the `INLINE` destination option.

descending.description: Whether to return the assets in the descending order. If OrderBy is not specified, this property is ignored. If OrderBy is specified, this property defaults to false.

calibratableOnly.description:
Gets or sets whether to generate a report with calibrated asset specific columns.
When the destination is "DOWNLOAD or "FILE_SERVICE" this property is used as follows:
- It determines the type of the report. When true, the file will be a calibration report. If this is false, the file will be an asset report.
- If asset ids are in the request, this property will not be used for filtering. If no asset ids are in the request, setting this property to true will generate a report only for the calibrated assets.

returnCount.description: Whether to return the total number of assets which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value.

filter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for assets. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid asset properties that can be used in the filter:
- AssetIdentifier: String representing the unique identifier of an asset.
- SerialNumber: String representing the serial number of an asset.
- ModelName: String representing the model name of an asset.
- ModelNumber: Unsigned integer representing the model number of an asset.
- VendorName: String representing the vendor name of an asset.
- VendorNumber: Unsigned integer representing the vendor number of an asset.
- PartNumber: String representing the part number of an asset.
- AssetName: String representing the asset name.
- AssetType: String enumeration representing the asset type. Possible values are: GENERIC, DEVICE_UNDER_TEST, FIXTURE, SYSTEM.
- FirmwareVersion: String representing the firmware version of an asset.
- HardwareVersion: String representing the hardware version of an asset.
- BusType: String enumeration representing the bus type of an asset. Possible values are: BUILT_IN_SYSTEM, PCI_PXI, USB, GPIB, VXI, SERIAL, TCP_IP, CRIO, SCXI, CDAQ, SWITCH_BLOCK, SCC, FIRE_WIRE, ACCESSORY, CAN, SWITCH_BLOCK_DEVICE, SLSC.
- IsNIAsset: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset is an NI asset or a third-party asset.
- Keywords: Collection of string values representing asset metadata keywords. Example: 'Keywords=["keyword1", "keyword2"]'.
- Properties: Collection of key-value pairs, each key-value pair representing an asset metadata property. Example: 'Properties=["key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"]'.
- Location.MinionId: String representing the identifier of the minion in which the asset is located in.
- Location.SlotNumber: Unsigned integer representing the slot number the asset is located in.
- Location.AssetState.SystemConnection: String enumeration representing the connection state of the system the asset is currently located in. Possible values are: DISCONNECTED, CONNECTED. To maintain compatibility with previous versions of SystemLink, the values [APPROVED, UNSUPPORTED, ACTIVATED] are considered equivalent to DISCONNECTED and [CONNECTED_UPDATE_PENDING, CONNECTED_UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL, CONNECTED_UPDATE_FAILED] are equivalent to CONNECTED.
- Location.AssetState.AssetPresence: String enumeration representing the present status of an asset in a system. Possible values are: INITIALIZING, UNKNOWN, NOT_PRESENT, PRESENT.
- SupportsSelfCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports self-calibration.
- SelfCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was self-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- SupportsExternalCalibration: Boolean flag specifying whether the asset supports external calibration.
- CalibrationStatus: String enumeration representing the calibration status of an asset. Possible values are: OK, APPROACHING_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE, PAST_RECOMMENDED_DUE_DATE, OUT_FOR_CALIBRATION.
- ExternalCalibration.CalibrationDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the asset was externally-calibrated. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z"
- ExternalCalibration.NextRecommendedDate: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the recommended date for the next external calibration. Example: "2018-05-20T00:00:00Z".
This value is overwritten by the NextCustomDueDate if it is set, otherwise it is calculated based on the RecommendedInterval.
- ExternalCalibration.RecommendedInterval: Integer representing the manufacturer-recommended calibration interval, in months.
- ExternalCalibration.Comments: String representing any external calibration comments.
- ExternalCalibration.IsLimited: Boolean flag specifying whether the last external calibration was a limited calibration.

QueryAssetsRequest.description: Model for object containing filters to apply when retrieving assets. If no assets match the filter and the destination is "DOWNLOAD" or "FILE_SERVICE", an empty report will be generated.

continuationToken.description: Gets or sets a token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching asset location history set. When querying for asset location history, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of asset location history records, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request.

responseFormat.description: Gets or sets the return type. Valid options are "JSON" and "CSV".

destination.description: Gets or sets the destination of the request. "INLINE" (default) returns the list of resources as the body of the response. "DOWNLOAD" returns the list of resources as the body of the response and indicates to the client that it should be downloaded as a file. "FILE_SERVICE" sends the list of resources to the file ingestion service and returns the ID of the file to the client in a JSON object.

fileIngestionWorkspace.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace to put the file into, if the destination is "FILE_SERVICE".

locationFilter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for location. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid location properties that can be used in the filter:
- MinionId: String representing the minion id of the location of an asset.
- PhysicalLocation: String representing the physical location of the location of an asset.
- Parent: String representing the parent of the location of an asset.
- SlotNumber: Integer representing the slot number of the location of an asset.

QueryLocationHistoryRequest.description: Model for object containing options for querying history.

assetIds.description:
Gets or sets an array of asset IDs that the client requests.
The maximum number of asset IDs allowed per request is 1000.

QueryLocationMovesRequest.description: Model which represents which assets the clients requests

moveAssets.description: Gets or sets an array of assets that are moving.

QueryLocationMovesResponse.description: Model which represents the assets that are currently moving to another location.

assetId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the asset being moved.

systemId.description:
Gets or sets identifier of the system to which the asset is being moved.
Either this, or PhysicalLocation are mandatory

physicalLocation.description:
Gets or sets physical location to which the asset is being moved.
Either this, or SystemId are mandatory

parent.description: Gets or sets the parent within the target location to which the asset is being moved.

receiveFromCalibrationOperations.description:
Gets or sets a list of operations that will update the asset calibration and  move an asset from one location to another.
The maximum number of operations allowed per request is 1000.

filter.description: Gets or sets the filter criteria for assets.

skip.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to skip in the result when paging. For example, a list of 100 resources with a skip value of 50 will return entries 51 through 100.

take.description: Gets or sets how many resources to return in the result, or -1 to use a default defined by the service. For example, a list of 100 resources with a take value of 25 will return entries 1 through 25.

orderBy.description:
Field by which assets can be ordered/sorted. If Filter is set but OrderBy is not specified, no sorting will applied.
If neiter Filter, not OrderBy is specified, the assets will be sorted based on their workspace and location.

descending.description: Whether to return the assets in the descending order. If OrderBy is not specified, this property is ignored. If OrderBy is specified, this property defaults to false.

SearchAssetsRequest.description: Model for object containing filters to apply when searching assets.

assets.description: Gets or sets array of assets.

SearchAssetsResponse.description: Model for search assets response containing the assets satisfying the query

temperatureSensors.description:
Gets or sets an array of temperature sensor information.
The maximum number of temperature sensors allowed per self calibration is 1000.

isLimited.description: Gets or sets whether the last self-calibration of the asset was a limited calibration.

date.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the last date the asset was self-calibrated.

temperatureSensors.description:
Gets or sets an array of temperature sensor information.
The maximum number of temperature sensors allowed per self calibration is 1000.

isLimited.description: Gets or sets whether the last self-calibration of the asset was a limited calibration.

date.description: Gets or sets ISO-8601 formatted timestamp specifying the last date the asset was self-calibrated.

SelfCalibrationProjectedModel.description: Model for self calibration, that supports projection

assetId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the asset being moved.

physicalLocation.description: Gets or sets physical location to which the asset is being moved.

parent.description: Gets or sets the parent within the target location to which the asset is being moved.

sendForCalibrationOperations.description:
Gets or sets a list of operations that will be performed.
The maximum number of operations allowed per request is 1000.

assetsWithStartedUtilization.description: Gets or sets array containing the asset identification data for the assets that started being utilized.

failed.description: Gets or sets array containing the asset identification data for the assets that failed to start being utilized.

utilizationIdentifier.description: Gets or sets string representing the unique identifier of an asset utilization history record.

minionId.description: Gets or sets identifier of the minion where the utilized assets are located.

assetIdentifications.description:
Gets or sets array of the identification information for the assets which are utilized.
The maximum number of asset identifications allowed per request is 100.

utilizationCategory.description: Gets or sets string representing the utilization category.

taskName.description: Gets or sets string representing the name of the task.

userName.description: Gets or sets string representing the name of the operator who utilized the asset.

utilizationTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the start of an utilization.
This parameter must have the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

assets.description: Gets or sets array of updated assets.

failed.description: Gets or sets array of assets update requests that failed.

UpdateAssetsPartialSuccessResponse.description: Model for update Assets Partial Success Response.

assets.description:
Gets or sets multiple assets that should be updated.
The maximum number of assets allowed per request is 1000.

UpdateAssetsRequest.description: Model for request body containing an array of assets to update.

keywords.description:
Gets or sets keywords associated with an asset.
The maximum number of keywords allowed per request is 1000.

properties.description:
Gets or sets properties associated with an asset.
The maximum number of properties allowed per request is 1000.

UpdateMetadataRequest.description: Model for the asset metadata information to be updated.

updatedUtilizationIds.description: Gets or sets array of utilization identifiers for the entries that were updated.

failed.description: Gets or sets array of utilization identifiers for the entries that failed to update.

utilizationIdentifiers.description: Gets or sets array representing the unique identifier of an asset utilization history record.

utilizationTimestamp.description:
Gets or sets a date time value which can be used to specify the end of an asset utilization.
This parameter must have the "ISO 8601" format in order to be considered valid.

UtilizationHeartbeatRequest.description: Model for object containing a collection of utilization identifiers with a timestamp.

ValidLocationMovementModel.description: Model which represents the validation result of a single asset move location operation
